title: UPS, FedEx Ground MD-11 Fleet After Fatal Kentucky Crash
snippets: UPS, FedEx ground MD-11 fleets after deadly Louisville crash Reuters
UPS and FedEx grounding MD-11 planes following deadly Kentucky crash AP News
The world's largest cargo carriers, UPS and FedEx, grounded their MD-11 freighter fleets at the recommendation of Boeing, the aircraft's manufacturer.

United Parcel Service and FedEx said on Friday they have grounded their combined fleet of more than 50 McDonnell Douglas MD-11 cargo planes following a crash in Louisville, Ky., this week that killed at least 14 people.
UPS Grounds MD-11 Fleet After Deadly Crash in Louisville Bloomberg.com
Delivery giants UPS and FedEx said they had made the decision to ground the fleet of aircraft after advice from the aircraft manufacturer.
titles: UPS, FedEx ground MD-11 fleets after deadly Louisville crash - Reuters
UPS and FedEx grounding MD-11 planes following deadly Kentucky crash - AP News
UPS, FedEx ground planes after Louisville crash
UPS, FedEx ground MD-11 air cargo fleets after deadly Louisville, Ky., crash
UPS Grounds MD-11 Fleet After Deadly Crash in Louisville - Bloomberg.com
FedEx and UPS have grounded their fleets of MD-11 cargo planes after the crash in Kentucky
summary: UPS and FedEx have grounded their combined fleet of over 50 MD-11 cargo planes following a deadly crash in Louisville, Kentucky, which resulted in at least 14 fatalities. This decision was made after Boeing, the aircraft's manufacturer, recommended grounding the fleets.

title: Former NHL Player and Ottawa Senators GM Mel Bridgman Dies at 70
snippets: Former NHLer with the Calgary Flames and the first Ottawa Senators general manager Mel Bridgman has died, the team announced Saturday. He was 70.
Former NHLer and Ottawa Senators general manager Mel Bridgman has died. He was 70.

Former NHLer and Ottawa Senators general manager Mel Bridgman has died. He was 70. The NHL Alumni Association announced his death on Saturday. The cause of death was not disclosed. Bridgman was the first overall pick in the 1975 NHL draft by the Philadelphia Flyers, where he spent his first six-plus
titles: Former NHLer, GM Mel Bridgman dead at 70
Former NHLer, Senators GM Mel Bridgman dead at 70
Former NHLer, Ottawa Senators GM Mel Bridgman dead at 70
summary: Mel Bridgman, former NHL player and the first general manager of the Ottawa Senators, has passed away at the age of 70, announced by the NHL Alumni Association on Saturday. Bridgman, who was the first overall pick in the 1975 NHL draft by the Philadelphia Flyers and also played for the Calgary Flames, had his cause of death undisclosed.

title: Trump Seeks Naming Rights for New $3.7B Commanders Stadium
snippets: Report: Trump wants D.C. stadium named after him Reuters

A senior White House source said there have been back-channel communications with a member of the Commanders ownership group, led by Josh Harris, to express Trump's desire to have the $3.7 billion domed stadium in the nation's capital bear his name.

Trump wants name on Commanders home, per ESPN White House source says move ‘will probably happen’ $3.7bn, 65,000-seat stadium expected to open in 2030 Donald Trump is pressing the NFL’s Washington Commanders to name their planned $3.7bn stadium after him, a bid he is pursuing through back-channel co
Trump is expected to attend the Commanders home game against the Detroit Lions on Sunday.
titles: Report: Trump wants D.C. stadium named after him - Reuters
Sources: Trump wants D.C. stadium named for him
Trump reportedly wants new NFL stadium in Washington named after him
Trump Wants Washington Commanders Stadium Named After Him, Report Says
summary: Donald Trump has expressed interest in having the Washington Commanders' planned $3.7 billion, 65,000-seat stadium in D.C. named after him. This has been pursued through back-channel communications with the Commanders' ownership group. A White House source suggests this move is likely to happen. The stadium is expected to open in 2030, and Trump plans to attend a Commanders game against the Detroit Lions on Sunday.

title: Federal Shutdown Triggers 1,000+ Flight Cancellations for Second Day
snippets: Thousands more flights have been delayed or cancelled as the reduction of air travel capacity continues during the federal government shutdown.

Charlotte, North Carolina, has the most cancellations – at 120 – as industry experts say other sectors might also feel effects US airlines again canceled more than 1,000 flights on Saturday, the second day of the Federal Aviation Administration’s order to reduce air traffic because of the government
Ground stops were in effect at several major airports Saturday.
titles: More than 1,000 flights cancelled as US air traffic cuts enter second day
More than 1,000 flights canceled on second day of cuts tied to government shutdown
More Than 5,000 Flights Disrupted Saturday Amid Shutdown Staffing Shortages
summary: The federal government shutdown has led to a significant reduction in air travel capacity, resulting in over 1,000 flight cancellations for the second consecutive day, with Charlotte, North Carolina, experiencing the highest number at 120. The Federal Aviation Administration ordered a reduction in air traffic, affecting several major airports with ground stops. This situation indicates broader impacts on various sectors beyond airlines.

title: Supreme Court Halts Order for Full SNAP Payments Amid Shutdown
snippets: Supreme Court issues emergency order to block full SNAP food aid payments AP News
Supreme Court issues emergency order to block a lower court order that required the Trump administration to disburse full SNAP food payments to states by Friday night.
The Trump administration tried not to pay for any food stamps in November because of the government shutdown. It now proposes partial SNAP benefits.
The Trump administration spent Friday fighting an appellate court battle to avoid restoring $4 billion in SNAP benefits in jeopardy due to the government shutdown.
titles: Supreme Court issues emergency order to block full SNAP food aid payments - AP News
US Supreme Court temporarily blocks order on full SNAP funds
Supreme Court pauses order that Trump administration must pay full SNAP benefits
Supreme Court blocks order for Trump administration to cover SNAP benefits — for now
summary: The Supreme Court issued an emergency order to block a lower court's directive for the Trump administration to distribute full SNAP (Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program) food aid payments. This decision came after the administration sought to provide partial benefits instead of full payments due to the government shutdown, challenging an appellate court's effort to restore $4 billion in SNAP benefits at risk.

title: US Flight Cancellations Top 1,330 Amid Government Shutdown
snippets: US airlines cancel 1,330 flights due to shutdown Reuters
US warns it could force 20% flight cuts if shutdown continues Reuters
US airlines cancel over 1,000 flights for a second straight day largely due to government shutdown AP News
Flights at 40 major airports were canceled as the US government shutdown fuels staffing shortages among air traffic controllers and baggage handlers.
titles: US airlines cancel 1,330 flights due to shutdown - Reuters
US warns it could force 20% flight cuts if shutdown continues - Reuters
US airlines cancel over 1,000 flights for a second straight day largely due to government shutdown - AP News
US airlines ground 1,300 flights for second day
summary: US airlines have canceled more than 1,330 flights for two consecutive days due to a government shutdown, leading to staffing shortages among air traffic controllers and baggage handlers. The US has warned that the shutdown could result in a forced 20% reduction in flights if it continues. The cancellations have affected 40 major airports across the country.

title: Elena Rybakina Wins First WTA Finals Title in Riyadh
snippets: Red-hot Rybakina scorches Sabalenka for maiden WTA Finals crown Reuters

Former Wimbledon champion wins 6-3, 7-6 (0) Unbeaten Rybakina takes home £3.98m Elena Rybakina re-established herself as one of the significant players in women’s tennis as she closed out a week of devastating performances against the best in the world by completely overpowering Aryna Sabalenka to c
Elena Rybakina continued her resurgence by winning the WTA Finals 6-3 7-6 (7-0) in Riyadh against world No 1 Aryna Sabalenka.

summary: Elena Rybakina won the WTA Finals, defeating Aryna Sabalenka 6-3, 7-6 (7-0) in Riyadh. This victory marks Rybakina's first WTA Finals crown and highlights her resurgence in women's tennis. She remained unbeaten throughout the tournament and earned £3.98m.

title: Trump Considers Sanction Exemption for Hungary on Russian Oil
snippets: Orbán says Trump will not punish Hungary for buying Russian energy, reducing impact of sanctions AP News
Viktor Orban, who has called access to Russian oil and gas a "vital" issue for his landlocked country, had the most to gain from a meeting with Donald Trump at the White House. And he did.
Despite a chummy relationship, new U.S. penalties on Russian energy were likely to be a sticking point as President Trump and Prime Minister Viktor Orban of Hungary met.
Trump Grants Hungary Exemption on Russian Oil in Orban Win Bloomberg.com
titles: Orbán says Trump will not punish Hungary for buying Russian energy, reducing impact of sanctions - AP News
Trump exempts Hungary from sanctions for buying Russian oil
Trump Signals Openness to Exempting Hungary from Russian Oil Sanctions
Trump Grants Hungary Exemption on Russian Oil in Orban Win - Bloomberg.com
summary: During a meeting with Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban, US President Donald Trump agreed to consider granting Hungary an exemption from sanctions on Russian oil. This decision comes amidst Trump's broader push for US allies to reduce their reliance on Russian energy. The exemption, seen as a victory for Orban, aims to mitigate the impact of sanctions on Hungary, highlighting the close relationship between the two leaders despite potential tensions over new US penalties on Russian energy.

title: Pfizer Buys Obesity Drugmaker Metsera for $10B, Outbids Novo Nordisk
snippets: Pfizer wins $10 billion bidding war for Metsera as Novo Nordisk exits Reuters
Pfizer to Buy Metsera for $10 Billion, Capping Bidding War Bloomberg.com

NEW YORK (AP) — U.S. pharmaceutical giant Pfizer signed a deal to purchase development-stage obesity drugmaker Metsera Inc., winning a bidding war against Novo Nordisk, the Danish drugmaker behind weight-loss treatments Ozempic and Wegovy. Metsera, based in New York, has no products on the market, b
titles: Pfizer wins $10 billion bidding war for Metsera as Novo Nordisk exits - Reuters

Pfizer clinches deal for obesity drug developer Metsea after a bidding war with Novo Nordisk
summary: Pfizer has acquired New York-based, development-stage obesity drugmaker Metsera Inc. for $10 billion, outbidding Danish pharmaceutical company Novo Nordisk. Metsera, which currently has no products on the market, was at the center of a competitive bidding war before Pfizer secured the deal.

title: Tanzania Arrests Opposition Leader Amid Election Protest Dispute
snippets: Tanzania police arrest senior opposition party official after deadly protests, target others Reuters

Chadema party says deputy secretary general arrested and calls election of incumbent president fraudulent Tanzanian authorities have detained a senior official from the main opposition party, Chadema, amid a spate of arrests in connection to deadly protests during elections last week. More than 1,00
African Union observers said the vote was not credible and that they had documented ballot box stuffing. The government has dismissed criticism of the process and said the election was fair.
titles: Tanzania police arrest senior opposition party official after deadly protests, target others - Reuters
Tanzania police arrest opposition party official after deadly election protests
Tanzania police seek to arrest opposition leaders after protests
summary: Tanzania police arrested a senior official of the opposition party, Chadema, following deadly election protests. Chadema disputes the election's legitimacy, calling it fraudulent. African Union observers also deemed the vote not credible, citing ballot box stuffing. The government, however, defends the election's fairness.

Court documents say Smith was charged by Halifax Regional Police on Oct. 2, and he is scheduled to appear in court Monday. A spokesperson with the Nova Scotia Public
titles: Trailer Park Boys actor Mike Smith charged with sexual assault for 2017 incident
summary: Mike Smith, known for playing Bubbles on "Trailer Park Boys," has been charged with sexual assault related to an incident on Dec. 30, 2017. He was charged on Oct. 2 by Halifax Regional Police and is scheduled for a court appearance in Halifax on Monday.

title: Perth Man Critically Injured in Single-Vehicle Crash on Highway 43
snippets: A 33-year-old Perth, Ont., man suffered life-threatening injuries in the single-vehicle collision Saturday morning, according to the Ontario Provincial Police.
Police said the westbound truck left Highway 43 west of Glenview Road early Saturday.

summary: A 33-year-old man from Perth, Ontario, sustained life-threatening injuries in a single-vehicle crash after his truck veered off Highway 43 west of Glenview Road early Saturday morning, as reported by the Ontario Provincial Police.

title: Water Safe After Train Derailment Spills Fuel in B.C., Tests Confirm
snippets: Tests show no contamination in Kamloops Lake’s water after 80,000 litres of aviation fuel spilled in a Nov. 1 train derailment near Cherry Creek, B.C., officials say.

VICTORIA — A local official said testing has revealed “no contamination” of a local water system on Kamloops Lake in B.C. after more than 80,000 litres of aviation fuel spilled on its shores in a train derailment last weekend. Michael Grenier, director for Area J of the Thompson-Nicola Regional Dist
titles: Officials says no contamination of a B.C water system after train derailment
Official says test reveals no contamination of a local water system after derailment
summary: Following a train derailment near Cherry Creek, B.C., on Nov. 1, which resulted in a spill of over 80,000 litres of aviation fuel into Kamloops Lake, officials have confirmed that water tests show no contamination. This announcement was made by Michael Grenier, director for Area J of the Thompson-Nicola Regional District, ensuring the safety of the local water system after the incident.

title: Florida Man Arrested After Crash Kills 4, Injures 11 in Tampa

A Florida man has been arrested after he lost control of his speeding car, which slammed into the patio of a bar in Tampa early on Saturday.
titles: 4 dead, 11 injured after a car chased by police plows into a crowd outside Tampa bar
4 dead, 13 injured after street racer slams into crowd at Tampa bar
summary: A Florida man was arrested following a car crash in Tampa's Ybor City neighborhood early Saturday, which resulted in four fatalities and 11 injuries. The man lost control of his speeding vehicle, causing it to hit the patio of a bar.

title: DNA Pioneer James Watson Dies at 97, Leaves Complex Legacy
snippets: James Watson, co-discoverer of the double-helix shape of DNA, has died at age 97 AP News
James D. Watson, whose co-discovery of the twisted-ladder structure of DNA in 1953 helped light the long fuse on a revolution in medicine, crimefighting, genealogy and ethics, has died. He was 97.
titles: James Watson, co-discoverer of the double-helix shape of DNA, has died at age 97 - AP News
James Watson, co-discoverer of the double-helix shape of DNA, has died at age 97
summary: James Watson, a pioneering scientist who co-discovered the DNA double helix, has died at 97. Awarded the Nobel Prize in 1962 with Francis Crick and Maurice Wilkins, his later years were overshadowed by controversy due to his racist and sexist comments. Despite his significant contributions to genetics and science, his remarks led to widespread criticism and ostracization from the scientific community. Watson's legacy remains complex, marked by groundbreaking achievements and contentious views.
